DOC.brief_summary: There is a gating mechanism in the dorsal horn of the spinal cord that acts to facilitate or inhibit transmission of pain signals to the brain. The gate can be closed by mechanical stimuli such as touch and vibration.
DOC.brief_title: Pain Blocking During Drug Administration or Blood Collection With Needles
DOC.detailed_description: The researcher develope a device that can use to reduce pain during drug administration or blood collection with needles.
DOC.criteria: Receiving an injection with a needle Able to score the pain on a scale of 010 using the universal pain assessment tool, preferably 7 years of age or older Current pregnancy Inability to understand and carry out instruction
